title: Marple (England)
name: Marple Aqueduct (Peak Forest Canal)
directions: turn right out of the station, then from the bridge on the main Station Road walk north along canal towpath (opp. St Martin's Road) for 1 mile
content: Passing part of the Marple Flight, a flight of 16 locks, a pleasant and undemanding one-mile walk along the Peak Forest Canal towpath leads to the impressive aqueduct (built 1794â€“1800) over the River Goyt; return via Brabyn's Park/River Goyt by way of variation.
